channel.title: Oracle® Database, 11g Release 2 (11.2) New and Updated Books
channel.description: This feed shows new and updated items. You will see links to all available items the first time you view it. After subscribing and marking items read, new and updated items will appear as unread.
channel.copyright: Copyright © 2018, Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved.

item.title: Oracle® Warehouse Builder Concepts
item.description: Provides an introduction to the benefits of using Oracle Warehouse Builder and its architecture and components. It also includes quick start steps, a user interface tour, and provides information about OWB preferences and OWB editors and wizards.

item.title: Oracle® Warehouse Builder Sources and Targets Guide
item.description: Describes data sources and targets for Oracle Warehouse Builder data warehouses and data integration systems. This guide also lists all the supported sources and targets and provides procedures for importing from sources and deploying to targets.

item.title: Oracle® Database JPublisher User's Guide
item.description: Describes the JPublisher utility useful for Java programmers who want classes in their applications to correspond to SQL or PL/SQL entities or server-side Java classes.

item.title: Oracle® Database Java Developer's Guide
item.description: This book describes how to develop, load, and run Java applications in Oracle Database.

item.title: Oracle® Database SQLJ Developer's Guide
item.description: Provides guidance to developers on SQLJ programming. This document can be read by anyone with an interest in SQLJ programming, but assumes at least some prior knowledge of Java, SQLJ, PL/SQL, and Oracle database.

item.title: Oracle® COM Automation Feature Developer's Guide for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Provides installation, post-installation configuration, and usage information for Oracle COM Automation Feature.

item.title: Oracle® Database Backup and Recovery User's Guide
item.description: A guide to backup and recovery of Oracle databases, including RMAN backup and recovery, RMAN data transfer, Oracle Flashback Technology, and user-managed backup and recovery.

item.title: Oracle® Database Backup and Recovery Reference
item.description: A guide to backup and recovery of Oracle databases, including RMAN backup and recovery, RMAN data transfer, Oracle Flashback Technology, and user-managed backup and recovery.

item.title: Oracle® Database Globalization Support Guide
item.description: Describes Oracle globalization support for the database. Explains how to set up a globalization support environment, choose and migrate a character set, customize locale data, do linguistic sorting, program in a global environment, and program with Unicode.

item.title: Oracle® Globalization Development Kit Java API Reference
item.description: Describes APIs for the Oracle Globalization Development Kit.

item.title: Oracle® Database Data Cartridge Developer's Guide
item.description: Describes how to implement custom indexing and query optimization services and how to package and use these as a server extension called a data cartridge.

item.title: Oracle® Database 2 Day + .NET Developer's Guide for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Serves as a quick start guide, which describes Oracle technologies for the Microsoft .NET Framework, including the key features of Oracle Data Provider for .NET and Oracle Developer Tools for Visual Studio. It leads you through installation and configuration, shows how to build basic applications using Oracle .NET products, and how to create and use both PL/SQL and .NET stored procedures.

item.title: Oracle® Streams Advanced Queuing Java API Reference
item.description: Describes the Java APIs for application development and integration using the Oracle messaging system, Advanced Queuing.

item.title: Oracle® Database XML Java API Reference
item.description: Describes the Java APIs for XML.

item.title: Oracle® Database XML C API Reference
item.description: Describes the C APIs for XML.

item.title: Oracle® Database XML C++ API Reference
item.description: Describes the C++ APIs for XML.

item.title: Oracle® Multimedia Reference
item.description: Presents reference information about using Oracle Database to store, manage, and retrieve images, audio, video, DICOM format medical images and other objects, or other heterogeneous media data in an integrated fashion with other enterprise information. (Oracle Multimedia was formerly known as Oracle interMedia.).

item.title: Oracle® Multimedia User's Guide
item.description: Presents information about using Oracle Database to store, manage, and retrieve images, audio, video, DICOM format medical images and other objects, or other heterogeneous media data in an integrated fashion with other enterprise information. (Oracle Multimedia was formerly known as Oracle interMedia.).

item.title: Oracle® Multimedia DICOM Developer's Guide
item.description: Presents reference and other information about using Oracle Database to store, manage, and retrieve DICOM content such as single-frame and multiframe images, waveforms, slices of 3-D volumes, video segments, and structured reports in an integrated fashion with other enterprise information. (Oracle Multimedia was formerly known as Oracle interMedia.).

item.title: Oracle® Multimedia Java API Reference
item.description: Presents reference information about writing Java applications using Oracle Multimedia objects to manage multimedia content within Oracle Database. (Oracle Multimedia was formerly known as Oracle interMedia.).

item.title: Oracle® Multimedia Servlets and JSP Java API Reference
item.description: Presents reference information about writing Java applications using Java servlets and JavaServer Pages (JSP) to retrieve and upload multimedia data from and to Oracle Database. (Oracle Multimedia was formerly known as Oracle interMedia.).

item.title: Oracle® Multimedia DICOM Java API Reference
item.description: Presents reference information about writing Java applications using the Oracle Multimedia object designed to store Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM) data within Oracle Database. (Oracle Multimedia was formerly known as Oracle interMedia.).

item.title: Oracle® OLAP Java API Reference
item.description: Provides reference information for the Oracle OLAP Java API.

item.title: Oracle® OLAP Java API Developer's Guide
item.description: Provides guidance for developing client applications using the Oracle OLAP Java API.

item.title: Oracle® Database 2 Day + PHP Developer's Guide
item.description: Provides a tutorial on how to develop PHP scripts that use the database languages SQL and PL/SQL to access and manipulate Oracle data.

item.title: Oracle® SQL*Module for Ada Programmer's Guide
item.description: Describes how to use SQL*Module to develop Module programs and Ada code to access and manipulate Oracle data.

item.title: Pro*FORTRAN® Supplement to the Oracle Precompilers Guide
item.description: Supplements the Oracle Database Programmer's Guide to the Oracle Precompilers to provide additional information on how to develop FORTRAN programs that use the database languages SQL and PL/SQL to access and manipulate Oracle data.

item.title: Oracle® Database Programmer's Guide to the Oracle Precompilers
item.description: Describes how to develop applications using the Oracle Precompilers and the SQL and PL/SQL database languages to access and manipulate Oracle data.

item.title: Oracle® Database Sample Schemas
item.description: Describes the sample schemas included in the seed database that ships with Oracle Database 11g. These schemas are used in examples in Oracle documentation, in curriculum materials, and in demos on Oracle Technology Network.

item.title: Oracle® Database Administrator's Reference for Linux and UNIX-Based Operating Systems
item.description: Explains how to create, configure, and manage Oracle Database on Linux and UNIX-based operating systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Platform Guide for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Provides platform-specific information for configuring and using Oracle Database software on the Windows platform. Topics discussed include: architecture, services, tools, configuration, administration, tuning, backup, accounts, passwords, user authentication, registry parameters, and application development.

item.title: Oracle® Streams Advanced Queuing User's Guide
item.description: Describes features of application development and integration using Oracle Streams Advanced Queuing (AQ). This information applies to versions of the Oracle Database server that run on all platforms, unless otherwise specified.

item.title: Oracle® Database Heterogeneous Connectivity User's Guide
item.description: Describes Oracle's approach to information integration in a heterogeneous environment. Describes Oracle Database Gateways and is a user's guide for these Oracle products.

item.title: Oracle® Spatial GeoRaster Developer's Guide
item.description: Provides usage and reference information for the GeoRaster feature of Oracle Spatial and Graph, which lets you store, index, query, analyze, and deliver raster data (raster image and gridded data and its associated metadata).

item.title: Oracle® Spatial Java API Reference
item.description: Provides Javadoc-generated information about interfaces and classes that support features available with Oracle Spatial, including GeoRaster and the topology and network data models, and with MapViewer, which is packaged with Oracle Fusion Middleware.

item.title: Oracle® Spatial Developer's Guide
item.description: Provides usage and reference information for indexing and storing spatial data and for developing spatial applications using Oracle Spatial and Graph and Oracle Locator.

item.title: Oracle® Spatial Topology and Network Data Models Developer's Guide
item.description: Provides usage and reference information about the Topology Data Model and Network Data Model Graph features of Oracle Spatial and Graph.

item.title: Oracle® Application Express Release Notes
item.description: Contains important information not included in the Oracle Application Express documentation.

item.title: Oracle® Application Express Advanced Tutorials
item.description: Features a series of tutorials that demonstrate how to use the Oracle Application Express development environment to develop Web applications.

item.title: Oracle® Database 2 Day + Application Express Developer's Guide
item.description: Offers an introduction to application development using the Oracle Application Express development environment.

item.title: Oracle® Application Express Application Builder User's Guide
item.description: Functions as a comprehensive, task-based reference on using the Application Builder development environment to build and deploy database-centric Web applications.

item.title: Oracle® Database Gateway Installation and Configuration Guide for AIX 5L Based Systems (64-Bit), HP-UX Itanium, Solaris Operating System (SPARC 64-Bit), Linux x86, and Linux x86-64
item.description: Provides Oracle Database Gateway installation and configuration information.

item.title: Oracle® Database Gateway for DRDA User's Guide
item.description: Provides users with transparent access to DB2.

item.title: Oracle® Database Gateway Installation and Configuration Guide for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Assists Oracle database administrators who are responsible for installing and configuring Oracle Database Gateways.

item.title: Oracle® Database Gateway for Informix User's Guide
item.description: Describes the Oracle Database Gateway for Informix, which enables Oracle client applications to access Informix data through Structured Query Language (SQL).

item.title: Oracle® Database Gateway for Sybase User's Guide
item.description: Describes the Oracle Database Gateway for Sybase, which enables Oracle client applications to access Sybase data through Structured Query Language (SQL).

item.title: Oracle® Database Gateway for Teradata User's Guide
item.description: Describes the Oracle Database Gateway for Teradata, which enables Oracle client applications to access Teradata data through Structured Query Language (SQL).

item.title: Oracle® Database Gateway for SQL Server User's Guide
item.description: Describes the Oracle Database Gateway for SQL Server, which enables Oracle client applications to access SQL Server data through Structured Query Language (SQL).

item.title: Oracle® Database Gateway for ODBC User's Guide
item.description: Describes the Oracle Database Gateway for ODBC, which enables Oracle client applications to access non-Oracle systems data through Structured Query Language (SQL).

item.title: Oracle® Database Gateway for APPC User's Guide
item.description: Assists in determining hardware and software requirements, installing, configuring, or administering an Oracle Database Gateway for APPC, developing applications that access remote host databases through the Oracle Database Gateway for APPC using the SNA Communication Protocol or the TCP/IP communication protocol, determining security requirements, and determining and resolving problems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Gateway for IMS User's Guide
item.description: Describes the Oracle Database Gateway for ODBC, which enables Oracle client applications to access non-Oracle systems data through Structured Query Language (SQL).

item.title: Oracle® Database Gateway for VSAM User's Guide
item.description: Describes the Oracle Database Gateway for Adabas, which enables Oracle client applications to access Adabas data through Structured Query Language (SQL).

item.title: Oracle® Database Gateway for Adabas User's Guide
item.description: Describes the Oracle Database Gateway for Adabas, which enables Oracle client applications to access Adabas data through Structured Query Language (SQL).

item.title: Oracle® Connect for IMS, VSAM, and Adabas Gateways Installation and Configuration Guide for IBM z/OS
item.description: Describes the installation and configuration of Oracle Connect for IMS, VSAM, and Adabas Gateways, a prebuilt driver to mainframe data.

item.title: Oracle® Database Gateway for IMS, VSAM, and Adabas Installation and Configuration Guide for AIX 5L Based Systems (64-Bit), HP-UX Itanium, Solaris Operating System (SPARC 64-Bit), Linux x86, and Linux x86-64
item.description: Provides Oracle Database Gateway installation and configuration information.

item.title: Oracle® Database Gateway for IMS, VSAM, and Adabas Installation and Configuration Guide for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Assists Oracle database administrators who are responsible for installing, configuring the components of the Oracle Database Gateway for IMS, VSAM, and Adabas and for diagnosing gateway errors.

item.title: Oracle® Database Gateway for APPC Installation and Configuration Guide for AIX 5L Based Systems (64-Bit), HP-UX Itanium, Solaris Operating System (SPARC 64-Bit), Linux x86, and Linux x86-64
item.description: Provides Oracle Database Gateway installation and configuration information.

item.title: Oracle® Database Gateway for APPC Installation and Configuration Guide for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Assists in determining hardware and software requirements, installing, configuring, or administering an Oracle Database Gateway for APPC, developing applications that access remote host databases through the gateway using either the SNA communication protocol or the TCP/IP for IMS Connect communication protocol, determining security requirements, and determining and resolving problems.

item.title: Oracle® SQL Developer User's Guide
item.description: Provides conceptual and usage information about Oracle SQL Developer, a graphical tool that enables you to browse, create, edit, and delete (drop) database objects; run SQL statements and scripts; edit and debug PL/SQL code; manipulate and export data; migrate third-party databases to Oracle; view metadata and data in third-party databases; and view and create reports.Note: This book is for an old release of SQL Developer. You are encouraged to use the latest available release. See http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/developer-tools/sql-developer/ for information about downloads and documentation.

item.title: Oracle® Application Express Installation Guide
item.description: Explains how to install and configure Oracle Application Express.

item.title: Oracle® Data Mining Java API Reference
item.description: Documents the Oracle Extensions to JSR-73, the Java standard API for data mining. The Oracle Data Mining Java API is deprecated in this release.

item.title: Oracle® Database Gateway for WebSphere MQ Installation and User's Guide
item.description: Provides access to WebSphere MQ services. This gateway requires a system that is capable of running 64Ebit applications.

item.title: Oracle® Application Express Application Migration Guide
item.description: Describes how to convert applications from either Microsoft Access or Oracle Forms to Oracle Application Express.

item.title: Oracle® Application Express API Reference
item.description: Describes the Application Programming Interfaces, referred to as APIs, available when programming in the Oracle Application Express environment.

item.title: Oracle® Application Express SQL Workshop and Utilities Guide
item.description: Describes how to use Oracle Application Express SQL Workshop and utilities to load and unload data from an Oracle database, generate DDL, view object reports, and restore dropped database objects.

item.title: Oracle® Application Express Administration Guide
item.description: Describes how to perform administration tasks for an Oracle Application Express workspace, application, or an entire development instance.

item.title: Oracle® Universal Connection Pool for JDBC Java API Reference
item.description: Provides Java API reference for Universal Connection Pool.

item.title: Oracle® Warehouse Builder OMB*Plus Command Reference
item.description: Provides a complete language reference for OMB and OMU commands, which comprise OMB*Plus. OMB*Plus is the programming language included with Oracle Warehouse Builder.

item.title: Oracle® Database Rules Manager and Expression Filter Developer's Guide
item.description: Provides usage and reference information about how to manage, index, and evaluate conditional expressions in relational tables.

item.title: SQL*Plus® User's Guide and Reference
item.description: Contains a complete description of the SQL*Plus command-line interface to the Oracle Database, and a complete reference to SQL*Plus commands and syntax.

item.title: SQL*Plus® Quick Reference
item.description: Contains a complete list of SQL*Plus command syntax.

item.title: SQL*Plus® Release Notes
item.description: Contains important information not included in the SQL*Plus User's Guide and Reference.

item.title: Oracle® Database XStream Java API Reference
item.description: Describes the Java APIs for XStream.

item.title: Oracle® Warehouse Builder Installation and Administration Guide
item.description: Describes installing the software and configuring Oracle Warehouse Builder (OWB). Part II of this guide provides procedures for administering OWB.

item.title: Oracle® Database High Availability Overview
item.description: Introduces Oracle best practices for deploying a highly available environment, helps you determine your availability requirements, and describes the database architectures that can help your business achieve high availability.

item.title: Oracle® OLAP Customizing Analytic Workspace Manager
item.description: Describes the Analytic Workspace Manager XML and Java plug-in interfaces and provides simple examples.

item.title: Oracle® Database 2 Day + Real Application Clusters Guide
item.description: Describes how to install, configure, and administer Oracle Clusterware and Oracle Real Application Clusters (Oracle RAC) on a two-node system using the Oracle Linux operating system.

item.title: Oracle® Multimedia Mid-Tier Java API Reference
item.description: Presents reference information about writing Java applications using Oracle Multimedia to extract Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM) metadata outside of the database, either on the client or in the middle tier. (Oracle Multimedia was formerly known as Oracle interMedia.).

item.title: Oracle® Database 2 Day + Data Replication and Integration Guide
item.description: Covers using Oracle Streams, materialized views, and other distributed database functionality.

item.title: Oracle® Database Extensions for .NET Developer's Guide for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Provides introductory, installation, post-installation configuration, and usage information for Oracle Database Extensions for .NET, which makes it possible to build and run .NET stored procedures or functions with Oracle Database for Microsoft Windows.

item.title: Oracle® Objects for OLE Developer's Guide for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Describes Oracle Objects for OLE (OO4O), a COM-based data access driver that combines seamless and optimized access to Oracle databases with easy to use interfaces, and shows how to use and configure OO4O from virtually any Microsoft COM Automation programming or scripting language, such as Visual Basic.

item.title: Oracle® Database Error Messages
item.description: Describes error messages that may appear while using products that are part of Oracle Database.

item.title: Oracle® Providers for ASP.NET Developer's Guide for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Provides introductory, installation, postinstallation configuration, and usage information for using these providers with ASP.NET services and controls.

item.title: Oracle® Automatic Storage Management Administrator's Guide
item.description: This is the 11.2.0.3 draft version of the guide.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen Application-Tier Database Cache Introduction
item.description: Describes the features of TimesTen Application-Tier Database Cache and provides information to help developers plan a TimesTen Cache application.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database Installation Guide
item.description: Provides information about installing and upgrading the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen Application-Tier Database Cache User's Guide
item.description: Provides information about designing and configuring the TimesTen Application-Tier Database Cache. It includes information about setting up a cache grid.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database Replication Guide
item.description: Provides information about designing and configuring TimesTen to TimesTen replication, including information about TimesTen integration with Oracle Clusterware.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database Troubleshooting Guide
item.description: Provides information about utilities and procedures for troubleshooting problems that may be encountered when using the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database C Developer's Guide
item.description: Provides information about developing C applications to access the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database through ODBC. It also includes information about TimesTen support for XLA, OCI, and the Pro*C/C++ Precompiler.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database Java Developer's Guide
item.description: Provides information about developing Java applications to access the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database through JDBC. It also includes information about support for TimesTen JMS/XLA.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database PL/SQL Developer's Guide
item.description: Provides information about using PL/SQL with the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database TTClasses Guide
item.description: Describes how to use the TimesTen C++ Interface Classes (TTClasses) library.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database SQL Reference
item.description: Provides a reference for SQL statements, expressions, and functions used with the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database, including TimesTen SQL extensions. It also describes data types.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database Reference
item.description: Provides a reference for attributes, built-in procedures, utilities, and system limits for the Oracle TimesTen In-Memory Database.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database System Tables and Views Reference
item.description: Describes TimesTen system tables and replication tables.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database PL/SQL Packages Reference
item.description: Provides reference information for packages provided with TimesTen PL/SQL.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database JDBC Extensions Java API Reference
item.description: Provides reference information for TimesTen JDBC classes and interfaces.

item.title: Oracle® TimesTen In-Memory Database JMS/XLA Java API Reference
item.description: Provides reference information for TimesTen JMS/XLA classes and interfaces.

item.title: Oracle® Database Utilities
item.description: Describes how to use Oracle Database utilities to load data into a database, transfer data between databases, and maintain data. The topics discussed include Data Pump Export, Data Pump Import, SQL*Loader, external tables and associated access drivers, the Automatic Diagnostic Repository Command Interpreter (ADRCI), DBVERIFY, DBNEWID, LogMiner, the Metadata API, original Export, and original Import.

item.title: Oracle® Data Provider for .NET Developer's Guide
item.description: Describes provider-specific features and properties of ODP.NET. Oracle Data Provider for .NET is an implementation of Microsoft's ADO.NET interface and provides access to Oracle databases.

item.title: Oracle® OLAP Expression Syntax Reference
item.description: Describes the Oracle OLAP Expression Syntax used to generate information-rich content from the data stored in dimensional database objects such as cubes and cube dimensions.

item.title: Oracle® Database Release Notes for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Contains important information not included in the Oracle Database documentation for Windows.

item.title: Oracle® Database Release Notes for Linux
item.description: Contains important information not included in the Oracle Database documentation for Linux.

item.title: Oracle® Database Release Notes for Oracle Solaris
item.description: Contains important information not included in the Oracle Database documentation for Solaris.

item.title: Oracle® Database Release Notes for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit)
item.description: Contains important information not included in the Oracle Database documentation for AIX.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Installation Guide for Linux
item.description: Describes how to install and configure Oracle Database Client on Linux.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Quick Installation Guide for Linux x86
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database Client on Linux x86 systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Quick Installation Guide for Linux x86
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on Linux x86 systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Quick Installation Guide for Linux x86-64
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database Client on Linux x86-64 systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Quick Installation Guide for Linux x86-64
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on Linux x86-64 systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Quick Installation Guide for IBM: Linux on System z
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database Client on Z/Linux systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Quick Installation Guide for IBM: Linux on System z
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on Z/Linux systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Installation Guide for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit)
item.description: Describes how to install and configure Oracle Database Client on AIX.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Quick Installation Guide for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit)
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database Client on AIX systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Quick Installation Guide for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit)
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on AIX systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Installation Guide for HP-UX
item.description: Describes how to install and configure Oracle Database Client on HP-UX systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Quick Installation Guide for HP-UX Itanium
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database Client on HP Itanium systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Quick Installation Guide for HP-UX Itanium
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on HP Itanium systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Quick Installation Guide for HP-UX PA-RISC (64-Bit)
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database Client on HP-UX PA-RISC systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Quick Installation Guide for HP-UX PA-RISC (64-Bit)
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on HP-UX PA-RISC systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Installation Guide for Oracle Solaris
item.description: Describes how to install and configure Oracle Database Client on Solaris.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Quick Installation Guide for Oracle Solaris on SPARC (64-Bit)
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database Client on Solaris SPARC systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Quick Installation Guide for Oracle Solaris on SPARC (64-Bit)
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on Solaris SPARC systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Quick Installation Guide for Oracle Solaris on x86-64 (64-Bit)
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on Solaris x86-64 systems.

item.title: Oracle® Database Quick Installation Guide for Oracle Solaris on x86-64 (64-Bit)
item.description: Describes how to quickly install Oracle Database on Solaris x86-64 systems.

item.title: Oracle® Text Application Developer's Guide
item.description: Provides information for building applications with Oracle Text.

item.title: Oracle® Text Reference
item.description: Provides reference information for building applications with Oracle Text.

item.title: Oracle® Warehouse Builder Release Notes
item.description: Contains late-breaking information about corrections, troubleshooting, and known issues for DB 11.2.0.4.

item.title: Oracle® Database Examples Installation Guide
item.description: Describes how to install and configure the products available on the Oracle Database Examples installation media.

item.title: Oracle® Database Data Warehousing Guide
item.description: Provides conceptual, reference, and implementation material for using Oracle Database 11g in data warehousing. It covers the full range of data warehousing activities, from physical database design to advanced calculation techniques.

item.title: Oracle® Database 2 Day + Data Warehousing Guide
item.description: Introduces the data warehousing solutions available in Oracle Database and discusses how to perform common day-to-day tasks necessary to implement and administer a data warehouse. This guide also provides information about design tasks needed to keep the data warehouse operational, including how to perform basic performance monitoring tasks.

item.title: Oracle® Database Semantic Technologies Developer's Guide
item.description: Provides usage and reference information about Oracle Database support for semantic technologies, including storage, inference, and query capabilities for data and ontologies based on Resource Description Framework (RDF), RDF Schema (RDFS), and Web Ontology Language (OWL).

item.title: Oracle® Services for Microsoft Transaction Server Developer's Guide for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Describes Oracle Services for Microsoft Transaction Server, which allows Oracle databases to be used as resource managers in distributed transactions. The guide describes its usage and configuration in a Microsoft Distributed Transaction Coordinator environment.

item.title: Oracle® Database Security Guide
item.description: Explains how to configure an Oracle database to use the default security features.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Release Notes for Apple Mac OS X (Intel)
item.description: These Release Notes contain important information not included in the Oracle documentation for Apple Mac OS X (Intel).

item.title: Oracle® Database PL/SQL Packages and Types Reference
item.description: Describes the packages provided with the Oracle database server. The manual is intended for programmers, systems analysts, project managers, and others interested in developing database applications.

item.title: Oracle® Database Readme
item.description: Describes last-minute features and changes not included in the Oracle Database Documentation Library for Oracle Database 11g Release 2 (11.2).

item.title: Oracle® Database New Features Guide
item.description: Provides an overview of 11.2.0.1, 11.2.0.2, 11.2.0.3, and 11.2.0.4 features, options, and enhancements that are new in each of these releases of the database.

item.title: Oracle® Database Real Application Testing User's Guide
item.description: Provides information about how to assure the integrity of database changes and manage test data using Oracle Real Application Testing, data masking, and data subsetting.

item.title: Oracle® Database Net Services Administrator's Guide
item.description: Explains how to plan, configure, and manage enterprise-wide connectivity with Oracle Net Services.

item.title: Oracle® Clusterware Administration and Deployment Guide
item.description: Describes the Oracle Clusterware architecture and provides an overview of this product. This book also describes administrative and deployment topics for Oracle Clusterware.

item.title: Oracle® Real Application Clusters Administration and Deployment Guide
item.description: Describes the Oracle Real Application Clusters (Oracle RAC) architecture and provides an overview of this product. This book also describes administrative and deployment topics for Oracle RAC.

item.title: Oracle® Grid Infrastructure Installation Guide for Linux
item.description: Describes how to install Oracle Grid Infrastructure for a cluster software, which includes Oracle Clusterware and Oracle Automatic Storage Management (Oracle ASM), on systems running Linux.

item.title: Oracle® Real Application Clusters Installation Guide for Linux and UNIX
item.description: Describes how to install and configure Oracle Real Application Clusters (Oracle RAC) on systems running Linux and UNIX.

item.title: Oracle® Database Installation Guide for Linux
item.description: Provides configuration information for network and system administrators, and database installation information for database administrators (DBAs) who install and configure Oracle Database and Grid Infrastructure for a Single Server on Linux.

item.title: Oracle® Database Installation Guide for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Provides configuration information for network and system administrators, and database installation information for database administrators (DBAs) who install and configure Oracle Database and Grid Infrastructure for a Single Server on Windows.

item.title: Oracle® Grid Infrastructure Installation Guide for Oracle Solaris
item.description: Describes how to install Oracle Grid Infrastructure for a Cluster software, which includes Oracle Clusterware and Oracle Automatic Storage Management (Oracle ASM), on systems running Oracle Solaris.

item.title: Oracle® Database Licensing Information
item.description: Describes Oracle Database licensing. If you have a question about your licensing needs, please contact your Oracle sales representative, or refer to the resources listed in "Related Documents" for more information.

item.title: Oracle® Database Client Installation Guide for Microsoft Windows
item.description: Describes how to install and configure Oracle Database Client on Windows.

item.title: Oracle® Grid Infrastructure Installation Guide for Microsoft Windows x64 (64-Bit)
item.description: Describes how to install the software for Oracle Grid Infrastructure for a cluster, which includes Oracle Clusterware and Oracle Automatic Storage Management (Oracle ASM), on systems running Microsoft Windows.

item.title: Oracle® Real Application Clusters Installation Guide for Microsoft Windows x64 (64-Bit)
item.description: Describes how to install Oracle Real Application Clusters on the Microsoft Windows platform.

item.title: Oracle® Grid Infrastructure Installation Guide for IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit)
item.description: Describes how to install Oracle Grid Infrastructure for a Cluster software, which includes Oracle Clusterware and Oracle Automatic Storage Management (Oracle ASM), on systems running IBM AIX on POWER Systems (64-Bit).

item.title: Oracle® Grid Infrastructure Installation Guide for HP-UX
